name: Holiday Inn London Bloomsbury

reviews.text: I stayed here for 4 nights and was very disappointed in both the service and the accommodation, especially for 180 pounds/night. The focus seems to be more on squeezing extra money out of guests vs. providing exceptional service. Upon checking in you will be asked to purchase prepaid vouchers for the breakfast buffet . After agreeing to purchase I realized on my checkout day I'd be leaving very early for the airport my last morning and would not be able to have breakfast. I requested that I be charged for only 3 breakfasts instead of 4, but was apathetically informed that the vouchers were "non-refundable". But I said "It is your own restaurant", to which I was received an apathetic stare and was told I could talk to a manager but she would tell me the same thing.
reviews.title: Very Disappointed

reviews.text: This was just the first in a sequence of negative experiences: 1) once turned on the air conditioning is programmed to turn itself off at certain internals - fully off, so when you return to your room or wake up at night it is steamy hot; 2) the room itself is cramped. The desk is so close to the bed you can't pull out the chair; 3) No refrigerator (just a hole where it used to be), no ice bucket, no ironing board....basically no amenities you would receive from similar hotels at this price level; 3) Generic bathroom. No towel bar, no soap dish, clogged drains, door cant't even fully open; 4) Towels and toilet paper are cheap; 5) closet too small to hang clothes properly; 6) Expensive Wi-Fi rates; 7) No fitness center - but they will happily charge you 5 pounds to use a nearby one; 8) Nice bar but they charge you 5 pounds for a pint of beer; 9) Would not call me a cab - instead I was told to drag my luggage down a block and try to flag one down.
reviews.title: Good business Hotel

reviews.text: I will not stay here again and will ask my company to remove it from their recommended hotel list. It is second rate at best and there are many hotels in the area that provide a much better experience at much better rates.
reviews.title: Just one night, but really great !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spent two nights in the Holiday Inn Bloomsbury recently. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Rooms clean and the food pretty good as one would expect.
reviews.title: Nice central hotel, but rooms are cramped

reviews.text: Short walk to Euston Station and Russell Square tube is just round the corner. A very good location in London.
reviews.title: great for train stations and the hotel is ok if you can get it below £130

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location
reviews.title: A good place to stay

reviews.text: The hotel has an excellent location, within easy walking distance to many amenities, shops, pubs, theatres, museums, and yet on a fair quiet area. It’s easy to get to, from subway (Russel Square) or train (St Pancras). And there is a bike station just around the corner if you like to get around by bike, as I do.
reviews.title: Home from Home - Fantastic Staff
Near University College of London
reviews.text: Rooms
You may wonder why opinions on this subject differ so much. Well, it’s simple, because there are different types of rooms.
reviews.title: Friendly and Clean - good location

reviews.text: We were in an executive one, so we didn’t try the basic rooms, which appear to be very small. It costs 25£ per room and night to upgrade. The executive rooms are also different depending on the floor they are. The executive rooms of the 1st floor are better refurbished and look nicer than the ones of the 6th floor, but they also are a bit smaller and probably noisier
reviews.title: mixed bag

reviews.text: Booked via HI own website, but upon check in there was no record of my Priority Club number etc., with a new one issued. A colleague was told that there was no booking (despite having printed confirmation) and was given a key to my room and burst in when I was there. Staff at reception did not seem able or willing to help, and this, coupled with late or missed wake up calls set the tone for the stay. It was only upon leaving, when the hotel wanted to charge again, did the concierge step in and take details. Follow up from Hotel Management has been excellent and whilst things took a few weeks to finalise, the overall outcome was good. Thank you.
reviews.title: Poor service made up for by follow up and attention

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would I stay again? Possibly, but only because of the concierge and manager. A simple admin error on the part of reservations became a nightmare. Thank you, Nic, for sorting this out.
reviews.title: Good Location but Overpriced!

reviews.text: We stayed here for the weekend in 2010 after booking at a discounted rate via the internet. We were so glad we didn't pay full price as we did not think it was worthy of the cost. The hotel is nice and clean and very presentable. Its also in a good location about 10-15 minutes walk from St. Pancras. The bar prices are very inflated so if you looking for cheap beer / wine head up to Wetherspoons round the corner. There was also a great indian buffet restaurant just 5 minutes walk away (can't remember the name) but we have since returned there the year after as the food and value for money was that good! Overall the hotel is OK to rest your head at the weekend and in a quiet location, but there are better hotels in London which offer better value for money.
reviews.title: Anyone for tennis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent two nights at this hotel, trip to London for Wimbledon. Was able to walk to hotel from Euston, only about a ten minute walk. The hotel is located just off main road close to Russell Square tube so that was a bonus. The reception area was nice and check in went without any incident, however when we got in lift to room the reception had not told us that room card had to be inserted in a slot in lift to go to the floor you wanted, so this caused us bit of confusion, we couldn't understand why we couldn't get to our floor. Got to room eventually, the rooms are very small indeed although they were clean and the decor not to unpleasant, not much room to move around really. The bathroom was average but very clean. The beds are also very small, really, i would imagine a tall person may find thier legs sticking out the end.The view from the room is awful, looks out into back of hotel, all the pipes and vents, room was also very hot, cant open the windows. The only problem we had with anything during our stay was that a dirty cup was left, they only left one clean one, and they only left us one clean bath towel, however a call to reception resolved the matter and housekeeping very quickly brought us up two more towels. When we checked out reception gave us a bill with somebody else details, address, credit card (only the last four digits) on which is a bit dangerous in this day and age.
reviews.title: A very quiet location in Central London

reviews.text: Pleasantly suprised with this Central London hotel. We had a double room on the quiet side of the hotel - everything we needed was supplied and what a comfy bed! We took advantage of having breakfast in the hotel as we had an early start the next morning and this was fab - also the staff were very friendly and attentive. Location is good and Russell Street tube only a few minutes walk away. Will use this hotel again for a one night stopover.
reviews.title: Pleasant place to rest the night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of this hotel is superb. We had early trains departing from St. Pancras and Euston Stations, and this hotel is walking distance from both. The staff were very helpful and welcoming. The Executive Room that we had was on the 6th floor and very clean. Loved the muffin and the Kit-Kat bar everyday. We enjoyed our stay here for three days.
reviews.title: IF LOCATION COUNTS, THIS HOTEL IS IT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a week from 7 May 2012- very handy to tube, buses, staff very friendly and helpful. Room clean and tidy, nice size. food in restuarant very good. Had a disabled bathroom which was excellent
reviews.title: excellent location, excellent staff, excellent disabled bathroom

reviews.text: Reviewed this a few months ago. My company keeps booking me in so heres another one. Hotel is well located but is let down by small and cramped rooms. The staff are excellent but cant make up for the buildings shortcomings. My bathroom was so small the door only misses the toilet seat by a couple of inches.Inside the room, the wardrobe didnt even have a door as there would be no space to open it. Menu ( revised recently) is poor with too much stodge, where is the fresh option??. If you want a one night stop for a meeting its just about ok, but with so much choice in this area you must be able to do better than this.
reviews.title: Great staff, Average hotel

reviews.text: Great stay. Bit of work and some leisure so perfectly placed for train arrival (Euston), the city for work, and for west end. Tube station is literally a minute away behind the hotel. Staff friendly and unintrusive. My only criticism is that the A/C turns off auto after perhaps 3 hours and that's not great for overnight cooling! Other than that, lovely.
reviews.title: Good hotel in great location. Nice bar furniture too!

reviews.text: I've stayed at this holiday inn before, several times but a free room upgrade to an executive room made all the difference.
reviews.title: Ive stayed before but really enjoyed it this time for some reason

description: Welcome to Holiday Inn London -Bloomsbury a modern and stylish hotel in London's West End, perfectly located for all of your leisure and business needs. The hotel can be found just off Russell Square Tube Station, close to St Pancras International Rail Station, which is very convenient for those travelling by Eurostar. Holiday Inn Bloomsbury hotel is also within easy reach of many of London's tourist attractions: The British Museum, Madame Tussauds, London Zoo and the West End theatres, not to mention the amazing shopping in Oxford Street and Covent Garden. The hotel is easily accessible for the O2 and also has a direct train link to Emirates Stadium, the home of Arsenal Football Club. Our state-of-the-art Academy Conference Centre boasts 14 meeting rooms that can cater for all requirements from training courses, boardroom meetings and conferences to Weddings and Dinner Dances. The Holiday Inn London Bloomsbury Hotel offers facilities for disabled guests along with accessible bedrooms, and two bedrooms with a hoist. The hotel is proud to have won Best Disabled Facilities Award 2007 'Accessibility for All' at the Meetings and Incentive Travel Awards. High Speed Internet Access is available in all bedrooms.
